thread.title: Samsung Galaxy S8 reportedly launching at multi-city event on March 29th
thread.title_full: Samsung Galaxy S8 reportedly launching at multi-city event on March 29th

title: Samsung Galaxy S8 reportedly launching at multi-city event on March 29th
text:
Samsung Galaxy S8 reportedly launching at multi-city event on March 29th Samsung Galaxy S8 reportedly launching at multi-city event on March 29th By - January 24, 2017 ‚ÄúThe Galaxy S8 will reportedly go on sale starting April 17th starting at around Rs 57,800‚Äù 
Earlier this week, a Samsung‚Äôs executives had confirmed that the brand would be skipping the Galaxy S8‚Äôs launch at MWC in February. Now @ Ricciolo1 , a tipster on Twitter, suggests that the Galaxy S8 will be launched at a multi-city event on March 29th in the US and Europe. MULTIPLE CITY event ‚Äù USA ‚Äì EU ‚Äù record breaking marketing campaign , et voila‚Äô üòâ https://t.co/492jEyVvDu 3/29 #samsung #galaxyS8 FIX IT ? ‚Äî Ricciolo (@Ricciolo1) January 23, 2017 
MWC has typically been the launch platform for most Galaxy S flagships launches previously. However, this time, the brand is delaying the new flagship‚Äôs launch at the event as its taking extra safety measures after the Galaxy Note7 fiasco . The tipster earlier had suggested that the phone will be available in major markets from April 17th onwards. 
As per the rumour mill, the Samsung Galaxy S8 will be available in two models ‚Äì the Galaxy S8 with a 5.2-inch Super AMOLED 2K display and the Galaxy S8 Plus with a 6.2-inch 2K screen. It will be powered by a Qualcomm Snapdragon 835 SoC, mated to up to 8GB of RAM and Adreno 540 GPU. The device is rumoured to offer a 12MP rear snapper, a fingerprint scanner and the highest IP68 dust- and water-resistance. It is rumoured to be priced starting at around Rs 57,800.
